Question: Their engagement failed, purportedly because of this person's drinking and erratic behavior.
Hints: After enlisting in the Army and later failing as an officer's cadet at West Point, this person parted ways with the Allans.
In January 1845 this person published his poem, "The Raven", to instant success.
This person tactically pled not guilty to induce dismissal, knowing he would be found guilty.
